result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy K. Oxberger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy K. Oxberger was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Jeremy K. Oxberger was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

filed by Atty Mark Frank
Filed by ADA Troy Cross
Filed by ADA Troy Cross

Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Reading waived.  Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 1 & 3 of amended information.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 2 dismissed. Victim Impact Statement filed by ADA Cross.  On Cts. 1 & 3 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years each count.  Conditions of probation on Ct. 1 include $443.00 costs, restitution $16.87. and Ct. 3 $243.00 costs.  Bond on hand to be applied towards restitution and costs.  No contact with any of the victims or their residences, or work place.  6 days credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-17-2015 02:45 pm
